snippet: A World Health Organization recommendation that travelers not leave Pakistan without a polio vaccination certificate has sowed confusion.
abstract: World Health Organization recommendation that travelers not leave Pakistan without a polio vaccination certificate causes panic; despite years of multimillion-dollar immunization campaigns led by the government and international organizations, Pakistan reported 59 new polio cases in 2014, by far the most of any country; WHO had reported only 68 cases worldwide as of April 30.

byline.original: By SABA IMTIAZ and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Saba Imtiaz reported from Karachi, and Declan Walsh from London. Zia ur-Rehman contributed reporting from Karachi, and Waqar Gillani from Lahore.

lead_paragraph: A World Health Organization recommendation that travelers not leave Pakistan without a polio vaccination certificate has sowed confusion.

headline.main: Disease of Pakistan’s Poor Now Worries the Affluent
headline.print_headline: Disease of Pakistan’s Poor Now Worries the Affluent
